meanings.definition: Outserts: advertising materials that are inserted into a publication but extend beyond its edges.
meanings.sent1: The outserts in the magazine were colorful flyers that fell out when you opened it.
meanings.sent2: I found some outserts in the newspaper that promoted a new product.
meanings.sent3: The outserts in the brochure seemed to be trying to escape from the pages.
meanings.sent4: The outserts in the catalog were like eager guests at a party, always standing out.
meanings.sent5: The outserts in the leaflet made it look more vibrant and interesting.

meanings.definition: Outserts: to insert advertising materials into a publication so that they extend beyond its edges.
meanings.sent1: She carefully outserts the flyers into the magazine before it goes to print.
meanings.sent2: The marketing team will outsert the new campaign materials into the brochure next week.
meanings.sent3: He outserts the leaflets with such precision that they always catch the reader's eye.
meanings.sent4: The designer outserts creativity into every ad, making them stand out from the rest.
meanings.sent5: They outsert the promotional materials strategically to maximize visibility.
